sentence.Network_en: We had a tiny little room which was christened Hades.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们有一个非常小的房间，取名哈得斯。

sentence.Network_en: Visitors to Hades often travelled far to the west.
sentence.Network_cn: 去冥府哈得斯的人一般都向西走,去往一个遥远的地方.

sentence.Network_en: Then Orpheus began to play his music and softened Hades'heart.
sentence.Network_cn: 于是奥菲斯开始演奏他的音乐,黑德斯因而心软.

entry.def: In Greek mythology, Hades was a place under the earth where people went after they died.

means.word_mean: 1. (Greek mythology) the god of the underworld in ancient mythology; brother of Zeus and husband of Persephone

sentences.sentence: "he didn't want to go to hell when he died"
